releases.notes: Tomorrow (French: Demain) is a 2015 French documentary film directed by Cyril Dion and Mélanie Laurent (Wikipedia). The documentary identifies initiatives that been proven themselves in ten countries as examples of solutions to environmental and social challenges of the twenty-first century in agriculture, energy, economy, education and governance, including climate change. Music for the film was written and performed by Fredrika Stahl (discogs).

releases.release_title: Nothing Is True & Everything Is Possible
releases.notes: Nothing Is True & Everything Is Possible is the sixth studio album by English rock band Enter Shikari, released on Ambush Reality and SO Recordings (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Nothing Is True & Everything Is Possible

releases.notes: "Time For A Change" by The Jade Assembly was released in the Fall of 2019 as a single, appearing in a music video featuring footage of the environmental activist group Extinction Rebellion.
releases.link_1_title: Metro UK - Extinction Rebellion in bid for Christmas No1 with song about climate change

releases.notes: "Thanks for Listening" is the seventh full-length studio album by American mandolinist Chris Thile. The album was released via Nonesuch Records.
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Thanks for Listening (Chris Thile album)

releases.notes: The Great Collapse is the fourth studio album by American deathcore band Fit for an Autopsy. The album was released through eOne Music and was produced by the band's guitarist Will Putney.
Be the Cowboy is the fifth studio album by Japanese-American indie rock musician Mitski, released through Dead Oceans (Wikipedia).

releases.release_title: Rise and Fall, Rage and Grace
releases.notes: Rise and Fall, Rage and Grace is the eighth studio album by American punk rock band The Offspring, released by Columbia Records.
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Rise and Fall, Rage and Grace

releases.notes: Miss Anthropocene is the fifth studio album by Grimes, released on February 21, 2020 (Wikipedia). The album, according to Grimes, is "a loose concept album about an 'anthropomorphic goddess of climate change,'" based on a quote from her Instagram reported on by NME in 2019. Grimes' full description of the album in the now-deleted instagram post was reported as follows in the NME article cited by Wikipedia: "It’s called Miss_Anthropocene. It’s a concept album about the anthropomorphic Goddess of climate Change: A psychedelic, space-dwelling demon/ beauty-Queen who relishes the end of the world. She’s composed of Ivory and Oil. Each song will be a different embodiment of human extinction as depicted through a Pop star Demonology. The first song ‘we appreciate power’, introduced the pro-AI-propaganda girl group who embody our potential enslavement/destruction at the hands of Artificial General intelligence" (NME). The digital-only version of the album art that was used for the album starting in December of 2020 depicts an elf figure with mechanical wings and tattoos holding a sword that is plunged through a bleeding earth (Wikipedia).

"Speak Your Mind" is Ian Kelly's second full-length album, released on indie label Audiogram (Wikipedia). The album art features a darkened side profile of Ian Kelly's head with an image of a tree placed on top of the album title (Discogs).

J. Ralph composed the music for the 2015 documentary "Racing Extinction," which covers biodiversity loss and its causes, including climate change (Wikipedia). Collaborations with the artists Sia and Anohni were released as the singles "One Candle" and "Manta Ray," respectively.
Jackie DeShannon released "You Know Me," an album of original songs, for the Varèse Sarabande record label in 2000 (Wikipedia).
Whiplash is the seventh studio album by English rock band James, released through Fontana Records (Wikipedia).
"Armchair Theatre" is Jeff Lyne's first studio album, released on Reprise records (Wikipedia).
"Red Brick City" is Heavy Water's debut album, a collaboration project between Saxon vocalist Biff Byford and his son Seb during the 2020 Coronavirus lockdown (Silver Lining Music).
Peggy Suicide is the seventh album by Julian Cope, released on Island Records (Wikipedia).
Rain in England is the second studio album by American rapper Lil B, released through Weird Forest (Wikipedia).

"Hey You" is a charity song written and recorded by Madonna. She co-produced the song with Pharrell Williams for the Live Earth campaign. It was released digitally on May 24, 2007 and was available on the CD and DVD of the Live Earth concerts on December 4, 2007 (Wikipedia).
Resist is the thirteenth studio album by Australian band Midnight Oil, released on 18 February 2022 by Sony Music Australia.
Cheat Codes is a collaborative studio album by American songwriter/producer Danger Mouse and American emcee Black Thought, released on August 12, 2022 by BMG (Wikipedia).
"Mother Nature" is Angélique Kidjo's 15th studio album, released on Decca Records France.
Constant Energy Struggles is the fourth studio album by American hip hop duo Ces Cru, released on Strange Music (Wikipedia).
Rock Believer is the nineteenth studio album by Scorpions, released on Vertigo on 22 February 2022 in the United Kingdom and 25 February elsewhere (Wikipedia).
The Desired Effect is the second studio album by American singer-songwriter and The Killers frontman Brandon Flowers. It was released on May 15, 2015, by Island Records (Wikipedia).
Death Atlas is the seventh studio album by American death metal band Cattle Decapitation, released via Metal Blade Records. The album release coincided with Black Friday (Wikipedia).
"On The Verge" is Nahko and Medicine for the People's second studio album.
Bloodstone & Diamonds is the eighth studio album by American heavy metal band Machine Head, released via Nuclear Blast (Wkipedia).

Vansire released their second album "Angel Youth" in April 2018 on Spirit Goth Records. Vansire produced and mastered the album themselves, and it is the band's first full length album that featured collaborations with other artists (Wikipedia).

"Atmosphere" is the debut album by Polish artist Wojtek. According to Wojtek's website, the album title "refers on the one hand to the climate crisis as I believe it is humankind's greatest challenge right now. On the other hand, it also refers to a very characteristic mood, feeling or ambiance that the music creates" (iamwojtek.com). The album was recorded using processes that are carbon neutral (any greenhouse gas emissions produced from the energy used to record the album were negated using carbon offsets) and Wojtek's website documents this process in detail.

Music for Earthworms is American hip hop artist Aesop Rock's debut album. The album was recorded during summers and other occasions on which Aesop Rock would return home to New York City from college at Boston University (Wikipedia).

Soul Punk is the debut solo studio album by American musician Patrick Stump, the lead vocalist, guitarist and composer of Fall Out Boy. It was released in the United States on October 18, 2011 through Island Records. Stump characterised the lyrics as being "90% metaphors", with lyrical themes dealing with self-belief, corporate greed, innocence and death (Wikipedia).

"Beds Are Burning (Dry Riverbed Version)" was released as a single in 2009 as part of the TckTckTck Time for Climate Justice campaign by the Global Humanitarian Forum (Wikipedia). The intent was to raise awareness of climate change ahead of the United Nations' talks in Copenhagen that year (Wikipedia). The original version of the song was written and released by Australian rock band Midnight Oil, who produced this cover version featuring many famous artists and influential voices including Lily Allen, Angélique Kidjo, Klaus Meine of the Scorpions, Simon Le Bon from Duran Duran, Tyson Ritter of The All-American Rejects, Bob Geldof, former UN secretary-general Kofi Annan, Archbishop Desmond Tutu, and the French actress Marion Cotillard, among many others (Wikipedia).
We Are All We Have is the eighth full-length studio album from American street punk band The Casualties, on the record label SideOneDummy Records (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - We Are All We Have

releases.notes: Grey Tickles, Black Pressure is the third solo album by John Grant. It was released via Bella Union (Wikipedia).
"Heathen" is GAWVI's third studio album, released on Reach records.

Firebringer is a comedy musical with music and lyrics by Meredith Stepien and Mark Swiderski and a book by Matt Lang, Nick Lang, and Brian Holden with additional writing by Stepien. It was the 10th staged show produced by StarKid Productions. The story follows characters in the prehistoric era where the invention of fire is studied (Wikipedia).
"Sincerely, The P" is the final studio album by People Under the Stairs, released on Piecelock 70, marking 21 years in the music industry for the duo (discogs, Wikipedia).
Continent is the fourth studio album of the American deathcore band The Acacia Strain released via Prosthetic Records.

Reincarnated is the twelfth studio album by American recording artist Snoop Dogg. It is his first and so far only release under his reggae persona Snoop Lion. The album was released on April 23, 2013, under Berhane Sound System and RCA Records. The album is his departure from hip hop and his debut in the reggae genre (Wikipedia).
The untitled ninth studio album by American rapper Nas, commonly referred to eponymously as Nas, or simply Untitled, was released by The Jones Experience and Def Jam Recordings (Wikipedia).
King's Disease is the thirteenth studio album by American rapper Nas. It was released through Mass Appeal Records and marketed by Universal Music Group (Wikipedia).
Finding Forever is the seventh studio album by Common, released on GOOD Music and Geffen Records.
Let Love is the twelfth studio album by American rapper Common. The album was released by Loma Vista Recordings and Concord Records (Wikipedia).

On October 23rd, 2018, Juice WRLD teased a snippet of a song while appearing live on Instagram. The song name is unclear, sometimes referred to as "In The Morning (Morning Again)" or simply "Morning." The unfinished song appears to be a collaboration with pop group The Chainsmokers.
releases.link_1_title: YouTube -  Juice WRLD - morning again snippet

releases.notes: "Some More" is an unreleased song by Juice WRLD. Its release date, according to SoundCloud user KWAN 2.0 (a frequent curator of Juice WRLD material), was February 4th, 2019, but this has not been verified with any other source. The song was up on YouTube for some time according to user FriendsAhoy before being taken down due to copyright issues with another song on the same channel, but a Google Drive link to download the video and audio remains posted in a YouTube video description for the song as of 2023.
Goblin is the debut studio album by American rapper Tyler, the Creator. It was released on by XL Recordings (Wikipedia).
Flower Boy is the fourth studio album by American rapper Tyler, the Creator. The album was released by Columbia Records (Wikipedia).

"Odd Future Unreleased Volume 4" is an unreleased collection of songs by musical collective Odd Future, including artists such as Tyler, the Creator, Frank Ocean, and Mike G. It is the fourth installment in a series of unofficial releases by Odd Future. References to "Odd Future Unreleased Volume 4" can be found with a little digging on websites such as SoundCloud, Genius Lyrics, and hypebeast.
releases.link_1_title: hypebeast - odd future talk presents unreleased volume 4

releases.notes: "Survival Story" is the second studio album by Flobots, produced by Mario Caldato, Jr. (of Beastie Boys fame) and released on Universal Republic and Island Def Jam. It is the follow-up to 2007's highly successful "Fight with Tools" (Wikipedia). The album art depicts a giant wave bearing down on a person standing on a rock in the ocean, visually illustrating conflict between man and nature, a common theme in the album's lyrics.

"I Feed These Streets" in a single by rapper B.o.B that was released on Spotify and Apple Music in 2010. However, it appears on YouTube only on unofficial accounts, including an account that uploaded it in October 2009 (YouTube).
releases.link_1_title: YouTube -  B.o.B. - I Feed These Streets (Prod. By B.o.B.)

releases.notes: B.o.B released the single "Flatline" on Soundcloud. It was released as a diss track aimed at astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson in response to an argument between the two of them on Twitter in which Tyson debunked B.o.B's statements in support of the flat earth theory.

"Global Warming" is an album by jazz saxophonist Sonny Rollins, released in 1998 on Milestone records. It was recorded on January 7th and February 28th, 1998, but the exact release date is unknown (Wikipedia).

"I Like How It Feels" is a song by Spanish recording artist Enrique Iglesias. The song features rapper Pitbull and producers The .WAVs, and the music video for the song has surpassed 45 million views as of May 2023 (Wikipedia, YouTube). The song was leaked on the Internet on 8 September 2011 after which it was uploaded to YouTube on 10 September 2011 (Wikipedia).

Rebelution is the fourth studio album by the Cuban-American rapper Pitbull. It was released through J, Polo Grounds and Mr. 305. The album debuted at number eight on the US Billboard 200 chart, selling 41,000 copies its first week (Wikipedia).
"One Degree" is Sunfruits' first full-length studio album, which was released on independent Australian record label Third Eye Stimuli.

Obviously is the seventh studio album by American band Lake Street Dive. It was released by Nonesuch Records. This was the group's last album to feature founding member and lead guitarist Mike "McDuck" Olson (Wikipedia).
"Free Yourself Up" is the sixth studio album by Lake Street Dive. It was released through Nonesuch Records (Wikipedia).
The Globe is the sixth album by alternative dance group Big Audio Dynamite II, their second album credited under that name instead of Big Audio Dynamite (Wikipedia).
The Big 10 is a mixtape by American rapper 50 Cent. It was released via his community website ThisIs50 as a free download (Wikipedia).

"Friday's On" by Ziggy Marley was released as a single with a lyric video posted on YouTube featuring video clips of protestors. According to Ziggy Marley's blog post about the song, "The song is inspired by the youth activists around the world fighting to make a difference for a better tomorrow. The song is accompanied by a special lyric video that Ziggy made himself, showing protests and marches around the world for various causes like #fridaysforfuture, #marchforourlives, and #blacklivesmatter" (ziggymarley.com).
releases.link_1_title: ziggymarley.com - New single “Friday’s On” + lyric video OUT NOW!

releases.notes: Space Between is the eighteenth studio album by American singer-songwriter Sammy Hagar, and the first studio album to credit Sammy Hagar and the Circle. This album was released by BMG and debuted at No. 4 on the US Billboard 200 chart, making it Hagar's second highest charting album to date (Wikipedia).
Randy Newman released the single "I'm Dreaming" as a free download in 2012 (Rolling Stone) and later as a track on The Randy Newman Songbook in 2016 (Discogs).
releases.link_1_title: Rolling Stone - Randy Newman Releases Wicked New Track ‘I’m Dreaming’

releases.notes: Dark Matter is the 11th studio album of original material and first of such in nine years by Randy Newman, released on August 4, 2017, by Nonesuch Records. Veteran music critic Robert Christgau ranked it as the sixth-best album of the 2010s (Wikipedia).

L.W. (subtitled Explorations into Microtonal Tuning, Volume 3) is the seventeenth studio album by Australian psychedelic rock band King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard, officially released on their own label. The album was preceded by 3 singles, ("If Not Now, Then When?", "O.N.E.", and "Pleura") which were released alongside music videos uploaded to YouTube. L.W. is a companion album to K.G. Explorations into Microtonal Tuning, Volume 2, released only four months before, and a continuation of microtonal themes first featured in Flying Microtonal Banana (2017) (Wikipedia).
"Global Crisis" is Australian hardcore band Wildheart's first studio album, which was self-released.
Coma of Souls is the fifth studio album by German thrash metal band Kreator, released in 1990 on Noise/Epic (Wikipedia).
Stony Hill is Damian Marley's fourth studio album, released on Universal and Tuff Gong (Wikipedia).
Existence Is Futile is the thirteenth studio album by English extreme metal band Cradle of Filth, released through Nuclear Blast (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Existence is Futile (Cradle of Filth album)

releases.notes: The Blood of Gods is the fourteenth album by thrash metal band Gwar, released by Metal Blade Records (Wikipedia).

Our Pathetic Age is the sixth studio album by American music producer DJ Shadow, released through Mass Appeal Records. It features collaborations with Run the Jewels, Ghostface Killah, Nas, Pharoahe Monch, and Raekwon, among others (Wikipedia).
"ORO, PLATA, MATA" is Mo'Ju's fourth studio album, released on Universal/Virgin Music Australia.
Georgia Mae's song "Gentle" was released as a single through Lemon Tree Music (YouTube).

Hazel Mei released "Golden Chains" as a single on Bandcamp and streaming platforms in October 2021 and then as a YouTube music video in the following months. "Golden Chains" was independently released.
"The Age of Convenience" is SheisArjuna's first full-length album, independently released in November 2021.
"Mother Dearest" is Meraki Mae's debut album, which appears to be independently released according to Bandcamp. The album was released in January 2022.
Dissenter is the debut EP from singer-songwriter Anya Anastasia, which was independently released (Bandcamp).
"Jamla is the Squad II" is a compilation album produced by 9th Wonder featuring numerous Hip Hop artists including Black Thought, Busta Rhymes, Rapsody, and J Cole (Discogs, Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - 9th Wonder - Compilations and Remix Albums

releases.release_title: WHAT THE HELL ARE WE DYING FOR? (Single)
releases.notes: "WHAT THE HELL ARE WE DYING FOR?" by Shawn Mendes was released as a single on Island Records shortly after writing and recording it. The single's album art notably includes an image of New York City covered in orange smoke from the 2023 Canadian wildfires (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - What The Hell Are We Dying For?

releases.notes: I Blame the World is the second studio album by American singer and songwriter Sasha Alex Sloan. It was released on May 13, 2022, by RCA Records (Wikipedia).

Album Minus Band is the debut full-length album from DIY collective Bomb the Music Industry! It was recorded by ex-Arrogant Sons of Bitches frontman, Jeff Rosenstock, in a bedroom. The album contains “Unlicensed cover songs. Unlicensed audio samples. Great times.” It is available for free download on the band's website, as well as on Quote Unquote Records’ website (Wikipedia).
"Manticore" is Shovels & Rope's sixth studio album, released on Dualtone on February 18th, 2022.

Ignorance is the fifth studio album by Canadian band the Weather Station. It was released worldwide on February 5, 2021 through Fat Possum Records in the United States, and a small part (digital or vinyl only) through Next Door Records in Canada.[2][3] The album's lead single "Robber" was released on October 14, 2020. The album's theme is based on Lindeman's contemplation of the global climate crisis (Wikipedia).
Aladdin (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) is a soundtrack for the film of the same name, released by Walt Disney Records on May 17, 2019.

releases.release_title: Charlie And The Chocolate Factory (Original London Cast Recording)
releases.notes: The London original cast album for the musical adaptation of "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" was released on October 7th, 2013 on Sony Classical Records (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (musical)

releases.notes: Midnight Movie is Shunaji's self-produced debut EP, released on May 4th, 2018 (bandcamp).
"American Love Call" is Durand Jones & The Indications' second studio album, released on March 1st, 2019 on Dead Oceans/Colemine (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Durand Jones & The Indications - Studio Albums

releases.notes: White Noise is the fifth studio album by Australian punk rock band The Living End, first released in Australia on 19 July 2008. It was the band's first album released on the record label Dew Process (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - White Noise (The Living End album)

releases.notes: Float is the fourth studio album by the Celtic punk band Flogging Molly. It was released on March 4, 2008, and debuted at number four on the Billboard 200 albums chart (Wikipedia).
Legal at Last is the eighteenth studio album by Canadian heavy metal band Anvil. It was released on February 14, 2020, through AFM Records (Wikipedia).

Empire is the fourth full-length studio album by the American heavy metal band Queensrÿche, released on August 20, 1990 on EMI. The album is Queensrÿche's most commercially successful release, reaching triple-platinum status.

Moral Panic is the third studio album by English alternative rock band Nothing but Thieves. The album was released on 23 October 2020 through Sony Music UK. The album was produced by Mike Crossey, with band member Dominic Craik also producing five songs (Wikipedia).
Moral Hygiene is the fifteenth studio album by American industrial metal band Ministry, released on October 1, 2021 on Nuclear Blast.
Red Letter Year is the 16th studio album by singer-songwriter Ani DiFranco, released on September 30, 2008 on her independent record label, Righteous Babe (Wikipedia).

Passenger released the humorous, politically charged single "A Kindly Reminder" in a YouTube video on February 17, 2017, shortly after Donald Trump took office as the 45th president of the United States.
releases.link_1_title: YouTube - Passenger | A Kindly Reminder (with lyrics)

releases.release_title: All I Know So Far: Setlist
releases.notes: All I Know So Far: Setlist is the second live album by American singer Pink, and soundtrack to the documentary film Pink: All I Know So Far. It was released on May 21, 2021, by RCA Records (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - All I Know So Far: Setlist

releases.notes: JID Released the DiCaprio EP on January 26th, 2015. According to SoundCloud, "The Dicaprio 8 track EP contains production from Johnny Venus of EarthGang, Deko, Childish Major, DJ Fu of EarDrummers, Brandon Thomas and more. Guest verses on this project come from EarthGang, OG Maco, Jace of Two-9 and Curtis Williams of Two-9."

Kendrick Lamar appeared on a single called "Cruel" with Jay Rock and MICrophone Tone, produced by Nachural, in 2010. It was posted as a free download to Hip Hop news website Hip Hop DX, and the track appears on Lamar's Wikipedia discography page.

Rockstar is the upcoming forty-ninth solo studio album by American singer-songwriter Dolly Parton. It is scheduled to be released on November 17, 2023, by Butterfly Records and Big Machine Records. The album is a collaborative project with a variety of rock musicians, marking Parton's first foray into that genre. Lead single "World on Fire" was released on May 11, 2023 (Wikipedia).
"See You Again" is the RTs' third full-length studio album, self-released on November 20th, 2020 on their independent label Wombat Squad Records (Spotify, Bandcamp).

releases.release_title: Style Wars: Attack of the Clones
releases.notes: "Style Wars: Attack of the Clones" is Jay Electronica's unofficially released follow-up EP to 2007's "Style Wars" (Discogs).
releases.link_1_title: Genius - Jay Electronica - Style Wars: Attack of the Clones

releases.notes: Everything Is 4 is the fourth studio album by American singer Jason Derulo. It was released on May 29, 2015, by Beluga Heights Records and Warner Bros. Records (Wikipedia).
Buffet Hotel is the twenty-seventh studio album by American singer-songwriter Jimmy Buffett, released on December 8, 2009 on Mailboat records (Wikipedia).

"Won't Give Up" was released as a single with an accompanying music video on November 13th, 2023. The video shows Pattie Gonia alongside featured artists Yo-Yo Ma and Quinn Christopherson performing near the remains of a glacier in Kenai Fjords National Park (YouTube).
releases.link_1_title: YouTube -  Pattie Gonia - Won't Give Up (feat. Yo-Yo Ma and Quinn Christopherson)

releases.notes: Woptober II is the fourteenth studio album by American rapper Gucci Mane. It was released on October 18, 2019, by Atlantic Records and GUWOP Enterprises (Wikipedia).
Soldiers of Misfortune is the third studio album by Sacrifice, released on Diabolic Force records. The album was released in 1990 in Canada, and on March 5, 1991, in the United States.
"Global Warming Christmas" is a Christmas single released by Sherwin Linton in 2008.
"Misunderstandings" is the first full-length album by Melissa Schiller. It was self-produced by the artist and friends and released on August 1st, 2013.
"Small Source of Comfort" is Bruce Cockburn's twenty-fourth studio album, released on True North records in 2011.

releases.release_title: Bloodshot Fisheye- Against the Current EP.3
releases.notes: Chali 2NA released his Bloodshot Fisheye- Against the Current EP 3 in 2015 on Manphibian records.
"Mixtape Messiah 3" is a mixtape released by Chamillionare on his website in 2007 as a free download to promote his album "Ultimate Victory" (Wikipedia).
"Confessions" is Dweezil Zappa's third studio album, released on Food for Thought records in 1991.

"From the Greenhouse" is the 12th full-length album by progressive rock band Crack the Sky, released in the spring of 1989 on Grudge records (Wikipedia). Reviews for songs off of the the album appeared as early as May 22nd, 1989, making this record an important early example of an album title explicitly referencing an idea related to climate change (the greenhouse effect) (Wikipedia).

releases.release_title: Very Sad Songs About Very Dead Animal Creatures
releases.notes: "Very Sad Songs About Very Dead Animal Creatures" is the 164th album by Matt Farley, released under the artist name "The Strange Man Who Sings About Dead Animals" on April 6th, 2012 on Motern Media (fandom.com).

releases.release_title: Papa Razzi Gets Introspective, Shares His Worldview, and Offers Advice
releases.notes: "Papa Razzi Gets Introspective, Shares his Worldview, And Offers Advice" is the 154th album by Matt Farley, and the 11th album released under the artist name Papa Razzi and the Photogs. It was released on June 8, 2011 on Motern Media (fandom.com).
releases.link_1_title: fandom.com - Papa Razzi Gets Introspective, Shares his Worldview, And Offers Advice

releases.notes: "Vote Republican!" is the 39th album by Matt Farley, released under the name "The Ultra Right Wing Conservatives." It is one of two politically themed albums released in 2008, the other being "Vote Democrat!" by "The Extreme Left Wing Liberals" (fandom.com).
releases.link_1_title: fandom.com - The Extreme Left Wing Liberals and The Ultra Right Wing Conservatives

releases.notes: Afterburner is the ninth full-length studio album by American rock band Dance Gavin Dance, released on April 24, 2020, on Rise Records (Wikipedia).

"Cool It Down" is the fifth studio album by American indie rock band Yeah Yeah Yeahs, released on September 30, 2022, through Secretly Canadian. It is the group's first album in almost a decade, following 2013's "Mosquito" (Wikipedia).
Mundo Viral is the first full-length album by metal trio Solo Borges, released independently in 2021.

Apocalypse: Save Us is the third studio album by South Korean girl group Dreamcatcher. It was released on April 12, 2022, by Dreamcatcher Company and distributed by Sony Music. The album is the first entry in a series of albums called "Apocalypse," with thematically consistent album artwork featuring the earth and outlines of crumbling buildings (Wikipedia).

"We Didn't Start The Fire," a cover of the original song released by Billy Joel in 1989 with re-written lyrics, was released by Fall Out Boy as a single on June 28th, 2023 and as a digital bonus track on the album "So Much (for) Stardust" (Wikipedia).
releases.link_1_title: Wikipedia - We Didn't Start the Fire (Fall Out Boy song)

releases.notes: "Apocalypse: Follow Us" is the seventh Korean extended play by South Korean girl group Dreamcatcher. It was released on October 11, 2022, by Dreamcatcher Company, and distributed by Sony Music. Apocalypse: Follow Us features six tracks including the lead single "Vision" (Wikipedia).

releases.release_title: PetroDragonic Apocalypse; or Dawn of Eternal Night: An Annihilation of Planet Earth and the Beginning of Merciless Damnation
releases.notes: "PetroDragonic Apocalypse; or, Dawn of Eternal Night: An Annihilation of Planet Earth and the Beginning of Merciless Damnation" is the 24th studio album by Australian rock band King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard, released on June 16, 2023 on the band's label, KGLW. The album's style incorporates elements of heavy metal. The album's cover art features the head of a large black reptile in the foreground and industrial equipment belching black smoke in the background (Wikipedia). The album's lyrics follow a complex and detailed narrative in which humanity causes massively destructive tornadoes by worshipping a "Motor Spirit," a deity associated with fossil fuels and the internal combustion engine. Humanity is ultimately destroyed by a fire-breathing dragon born of the attempts at witchcraft to stop the killer storms (Genius Lyrics, album liner notes).

artists.name: Testament
artists.notes: Bay area thrash metal band known for being one of the /"Big 8/" in the 1980s.

artists.name: ANOHNI
artists.notes: English-born singer, songwriter, and visual artist. She is a member of Antony and the Johnsons. She was the first openly transgender performer to be nominated for an Academy Award, which was for Best Original Song (Manta Ray) in 2016.

artists.name: Childish Gambino
artists.notes: Childish Gambino is the stage name of actor, rapper, and singer Donald Glover. It is rumored that the name "Childish Gambino" came from entering "Donald Glover" into an early version of the online Wu-Tang Clan name generator. Glover has a substantial legacy in film and television as well as music, and is known for both rapping and singing. He is known to include political commentary in his music.

artists.name: Megadeth
artists.notes: Megadeth is a thrash metal band from California, known for being among the "Big Four" of thrash metal (alongside Metallica, Slayer, and Anthrax). Megadeth is known for technical musicianship, political lyrics, and rapid lineup changes (Mustaine is the frontman and only consistent member of the group).

artists.name: Gojira
artists.notes: Gojira is a heavy metal band from Ondres, France. They are known for playing in the style of technical death metal and including environmental themes in their lyrics.

artists.name: Smash Mouth
artists.notes: Smash Mouth is an American rock band from San Jose, California. They are very well known for their hit song "All Star," which appeared in the opening credits of the 2001 film "Shrek."

artists.name: K.Flay
artists.notes: K.FLay is an American Singer, Songwriter, and Rapper.

artists.name: Stray From The Path
artists.notes: Stray From The Path is an American hardcore punk band from Long Island, NY. They are known for including elements of metal and hip-hop in their music and including political themes in their lyrics.

artists.name: Yasiin Bey (prev. Mos Def)
artists.notes: Yasiin Bey, previously known as Mos Def, is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, and actor.

artists.name: Bad Religion
artists.notes: Bad Religion is an American punk rock band formed in Los Angeles, California in 1980. They are known for political messages in their lyrics.

artists.name: Above & Beyond
artists.notes: Above & Beyond is an electronic music group formed in the United Kingdom consisting of DJs Tony McGuiness, Jono Grant, and Paavo Siljamäki. They are the founders of the Anjunabeats and Anjunadeep electronic dance music record labels (Wikipedia).

artists.name: OceanLab (Above & Beyond presents)
artists.notes: OceanLab, or Above & Beyond presents OceanLab, is a vocal trance group formed in London, England, in 2000, consisting of vocalist Justine Suissa and the three members of Above & Beyond: Jono Grant, Paavo Siljamäki, and Tony McGuinness (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Melissa Etheridge
artists.notes: Melissa Etheridge is an American singer, songwriter, guitarist, and activist (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Thom Yorke
artists.notes: Thom Yorke is a musician from the United Kingdom notable for his role as the frontman of the group Radiohead and for his solo material. He is very politically active on a number of issues, including animal ethics, geopolitics, and the environment (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Pitbull
artists.notes: Pitbull (given name Armando Christian Pérez) is a Cuban-American rapper from Miami, Florida.

artists.name: Macy Gray
artists.notes: Macy Gray, whose given name is Natalie Renée McIntyre, is an American R&B and soul singer and actress from Canton, Ohio (Wikipedia).

artists.name: OneRepublic
artists.notes: OneRepublic is an American pop rock band from Colorado Springs, Colorado (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Billie Eilish
artists.notes: Billie Eilish is an American singer/songwriter from Los Angeles, California.

artists.name: Muse
artists.notes: Muse is an English rock trio from Teignmouth, Devon, consistent of frontman, singer, and multi-instrumentalist Matt Bellamy, bassist Chris Wolstenholme, and drummer Dominic Howard.

artists.name: Gorillaz
artists.notes: Gorillaz is a collaboration between musician Damon Albarn (formerly of the band Blur) and cartoon artist Jamie Hewlett, formed in London, England (Wikipedia). Gorillaz is known for being a "virtual band," composing songs performed by the animated fictional characters 2-D, Noodle, Russel, and Murdoc. The collaboration often features other musicians in a variety of genres including underground hip-hop.

artists.name: John Meredith
artists.notes: John Meredith is the drummer for the band Suaka, a NYC-based metal band with deep roots in Indonesian culture.

artists.name: Cattle Decapitation
artists.notes: Cattle Decapitation is an American heavy metal band from San Diego, California. They play music in the metal sub-genres of death metal and grindcore. Consistent with the group's name, Cattle Decapitation's lyrics and album art often reference the gruesome suffering of animals in industrial animal agriculture.

artists.name: Fatboy Slim
artists.notes: Norman Cook, better known by stage name Fatboy Slim, is an English musician, DJ and record producer known for a heavily sampled style of electronic music called Big Beat (Wikipedia).

artists.name: 3Unit
artists.notes: 3Unit was a college rock band formed in Ithaca, NY. They were active from 2011 - 2015 and had a reunion show in Boston in 2018.

artists.name: Alex Goldman
artists.notes: Alex Goldman is a songwriter, guitarist, and synth player, as well as an acclaimed journalist. He was a host of Gimlet Media's podcast "Reply All" from 2014 to 2022.

artists.name: The 1975
artists.notes: The 1975 is an English pop rock band from Wilmslow, Cheshire, formed in 2002 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Lil Dicky
artists.notes: Lil Dicky is the stage name of David Andrew Bird, an American rapper, comedian, and actor from the suburbs of Philadelphia (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Various Artists
artists.notes: This artist entry is used for recordings with many artists.

artists.name: Miley Cyrus
artists.notes: Miley Cyrus is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and television personality from Tenessee. As of 2022, she has attained the most US Billboard 200 top-five albums in the 21st century by a female artist. She is the daughter of country singer Billy Ray Cyrus and the god-daughter of Dolly Parton, and she was known for playing Hannah Montana in the Disney TV series of the same name (Wikipedia).

artists.name: EARTHGANG
artists.notes: EARTHGANG is an American hip hop duo from Atlanta, Georgia, composed of Olu (aka Johnny Venus) and WowGr8 (aka Doctur Dot – born Eian Parker)(Wikipedia).

artists.name: Finneas
artists.notes: Finneas Baird O'Connell, known simply as Finneas, is an American singer-songwriter, record producer, and actor. He is the brother of Billie Eilish and often collaborates with her on music.

artists.name: 30 Seconds to Mars
artists.notes: 30 Seconds to Mars is an American rock band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 1998. The band consists of brothers Jared Leto (lead vocals, guitar, bass, keyboards) and Shannon Leto (drums, percussion) (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross
artists.notes: Michael Trent Reznor is an American musician, singer, songwriter, record producer, and composer, known for his leadership of the industrial rock group Nine Inch Nails (Wikipedia). Atticus Matthew Cowper Ross is an English musician, record producer, composer, and audio engineer, known for collaborations with Trent Reznor on Nine Inch Nails and film soundtracks (Wikipedia). The duo have received much recognition for their film scores, including the Academy Award for Best Original Score for The Social Network in 2010 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Lupe Fiasco
artists.notes: Wasalu Muhammad Jaco, better known by his stage name Lupe Fiasco, is an American rapper, singer, record producer, and entrepreneur from Chicago (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Esperanza Spalding
artists.notes: Esperanza Spalding is an American bassist, singer, songwriter, and composer. Her accolades include five Grammy Awards, a Boston Music Award, and a Soul Train Music Award. She was hired as a bass teacher by Berklee College of Music at the age of 20, becoming one of the youngest teachers in the history of the institution (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Neil Young and Crazy Horse
artists.notes: Crazy Horse is an American rock band formed in Los Angeles, known for collaborating with Neil Young, a Canadian-American singer, musician, and songwriter (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Radiohead
artists.notes: Radiohead is an English rock band formed in Abingdon, Oxfordshire by frontman and vocalist Thom Yorke, multi-instrumentalist Johnny Greenwood, bassist Colin Greenwood, guitarist Ed O'Brien, and drummer Philip Selway (Wikipedia). Radiohead is known for activism, including environmental activism specific to climate change.
artists.link_2_title: Wikipedia - Thom Yorke Activism on Climate Change

artists.name: Dream Theater
artists.notes: Dream Theater is an American progressive metal band formed in Boston. Founding members John Petrucci, John Myung, and Mike Portnoy founded the band, then named "Majesty," while attending Berklee College of Music (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Sepultura
artists.notes: Sepultura is a Brazilian heavy metal band from Belo Horizonte, founded in 1984 by Max and Igor Cavalera. The band has made significant contributions to the metal subgenres of thrash metal, death metal, and groove metal (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Scorpions
artists.notes: Scorpions are a German rock band formed in Hanover in 1965. The band has played in many rock styles, including hard rock, heavy metal, glam rock, and soft rock (Wikipedia).

artists.name: King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard
artists.notes: King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard is an Australian rock band formed in Melbourne, Victoria in 2010. They are known for playing in many genres, including psychedelic rock, heavy metal, and microtonal music, and releasing music rapidly (they released five studio albums in 2017).
artists.link_1_title: Wikipedia - King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard

artists.name: Alter Bridge
artists.notes: Alter Bridge is an American rock band from Orlando, Florida. The band was formed in 2004 by vocalist/rhythm guitarist Myles Kennedy, lead guitarist Mark Tremonti, bassist Brian Marshall and drummer Scott Phillips. Several of the members previously played in the rock band Creed.

artists.name: NOFX
artists.notes: NOFX is an American punk rock band formed in Los Angeles, California in 1983. They have never been signed to a major label, despite being influential in the punk revival of the 1990s (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Arrested Development
artists.notes: Arrested Development is an American hip hop group that formed in Atlanta in 1988.

artists.name: Axxis
artists.notes: Axxis is a German hard rock and heavy metal band that was founded in 1988.

artists.name: Baby FuzZ
artists.notes: Brandon Lowry, better known by his stage names Sterling Fox or Baby FuzZ, is a songwriter, record producer and recording artist.

artists.name: Ben Lee
artists.notes: Ben Lee is an Australian musician and actor, formerly a member of the band Noise Addict.

artists.name: Bill Madden
artists.notes: Bill Madden is an American singer-wongwriter and activist from California. He resides in New York City.

artists.name: Bliss n Eso
artists.notes: Bliss n Eso (formerly known as Bliss n' Esoterikizm) are an Australian hip hop trio based in Sydney, New South Wales. The group of Jonathan Notley (MC Bliss), Max MacKinnon (MC Eso) and Tarik Ejjamai (DJ Izm).

artists.name: Bob Mould
artists.notes: Bob Mould is an American vocalist, guitarist, and songwriter known for his roles in the bands Hüsker Dü in the 1980s and Sugar in the 1990s as well as solo material.

artists.name: Bob Seger
artists.notes: Bob Seger is an American singer, songwriter, and musician from Detroit known for his work with The Silver Bullet Band.

artists.name: Brad Paisley
artists.notes: Brad Paisley is an American country music singer and songwriter from West Virginia.

artists.name: Bruce Cockburn
artists.notes: Bruce Cockburn is a Canadian singer-songwriter and guitarist. He has written over 350 songs on 34 albums over a career spanning 50 years (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Cody Simpson & The Tide
artists.notes: Cody Simpson is an Australian swimmer and singer from Queensland. Cody Simpson and the Tide is composed of Cody Simpson on vocals and guitar, Adrian Cota on drums and Shareef "Reef" Addo on bass.

artists.name: Corb Lund
artists.notes: Corb Lund is a Canadian country and western singer-songwriter from Taber, Alberta, Canada.

artists.name: Deep Purple
artists.notes: Deep Purple are an English rock band formed in London in 1968, credited with influencing the development of the hard rock and heavy metal genres.

artists.name: Lana Del Rey
artists.notes: Elizabeth Woolridge Grant, known professionally as Lana Del Rey, is an American singer and songwriter.

artists.name: Disturbed
artists.notes: Disturbed is an American heavy metal band from Chicago, formed in 1994.

artists.name: Don Henley
artists.notes: Don Henley is an American musician and a founding member of the rock band Eagles.

artists.name: The Postal Service
artists.notes: The Postal Service was an American indie pop supergroup from Seattle, Washington, consisting of singer Ben Gibbard, producer Jimmy Tamborello, and Jenny Lewis on background vocals (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Aesop Rock
artists.notes: Ian Matthias Bavitz, better known by his stage name Aesop Rock, is an American rapper and producer from Long Island, New York. He was at the forefront of the new wave of underground and alternative hip hop acts that emerged during the late 1990s and early 2000s (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Yeah Yeah Yeahs
artists.notes: Yeah Yeah Yeahs are an American indie rock band formed in New York City in 2000. The group is composed of vocalist and pianist Karen O (born Karen Lee Orzolek), guitarist and keyboardist Nick Zinner, and drummer Brian Chase. Multiple Yeah Yeah Yeahs albums have won Grammy awards under the category "Best Alternative Music Album." Their 2022 album "Cool It Down" was nominated but did not win (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Anti-Flag
artists.notes: Anti-Flag is an American punk rock band from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, known for its left-wing political activism (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Rise Against
artists.notes: Rise Against is an American punk rock band from Chicago, formed in 1999 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Evildead
artists.notes: Evildead is an American thrash metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1986 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Steven Price
artists.notes: Steven Price (born 22 April 1977) is a British film composer (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Enter Shikari
artists.notes: Enter Shikari (stylised as enter: shikari and occasionally as ΣΠΤΣ℞ SΗΦΚ∆℞Φ) are a British rock band formed in St Albans, Hertfordshire, England in 1999 by bassist Chris Batten, lead vocalist and keyboardist Rou Reynolds, and drummer Rob Rolfe. In 2003, guitarist Rory Clewlow joined the band to complete its current line-up, and it adopted its current name (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Fightstar
artists.notes: Fightstar are a British rock band from London that formed in 2003. The band is composed of lead vocalist, guitarist and keyboardist Charlie Simpson, guitarist and co-vocalist Alex Westaway, bassist Dan Haigh and drummer Omar Abidi (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Captain Sea Level
artists.notes: Captain Sea Level is an pseudonymous musical artist who, according to one website documenting his music, "sang songs about sea level rise at various forums in coastal states during the 1980s" (song.risingsea.net). Captain Sea Level appeared as musical entertainment on Tuesday, December 6th, 1988 at day one of the Climate Institute's Second North American Conference on Climate Change: A Cooperative Approach (climate.org archive). A scanned copy of the Climate Institute's "Climate Alert" bulletin from Fall 1988 lists Captain Sea Level as "Balladeer of the Climate Community" (climate.org archive).
artists.link_2_title: climate.org archive - Climate Alert 1988 Fall Bulletin

artists.name: Fredrika Stahl
artists.notes: Fredrika Stahl is a Swedish singer and songwriter signed to Sony Music in France. Her style is a mix of jazz and pop.

artists.name: The Jade Assembly
artists.notes: The Jade Assembly is an alternative rock group from Bolton, England, that started releasing music in the mid 2010s (Soundcloud).

artists.name: Grimes
artists.notes: Claire Elise Boucher, known professionally as Grimes, is a Canadian musician, singer, songwriter, and record producer. Her lyrics often touch on science fiction and feminist themes (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Ian Kelly
artists.notes: Ian Kelly is a Canadian singer-songwriter. He has released several full-length albums and has been nominated for numerous Felix Awards (Wikipedia).

artists.name: J. Ralph
artists.notes: Josh Ralph, known professionally as J. Ralph, is an American composer, producer, singer/songwriter and social activist who focuses on creating awareness and change through music and film (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Jackie DeShannon
artists.notes: Jackie DeShannon (born Sharon Lee Myers) is an American singer-songwriter and radio broadcaster with a string of hit song credits from the 1960s onwards, as both singer and composer (Wikipedia).

artists.name: James
artists.notes: James are an English rock band from Manchester, who were formed in 1982 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Jeff Lynne
artists.notes: Jeffrey Lynne is an English musician, singer-songwriter, and record producer. He is best known as the co-founder of the rock band Electric Light Orchestra (ELO), which was formed in 1970. He was also a member of the supergroup Traveling Wilburys and produced solo material (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Heavy Water
artists.notes: Heavy Water is a collaboration project between Biff Byford and his son, Seb Byford during the 2020 Coronavirus lockdowns (Silver Lining Music). Biff Byford is known for being the lead singer of heavy metal band Saxon (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Damian Marley
artists.notes: Damian Robert Nesta "Jr. Gong" Marley is a Jamaican DJ, singer, lyricist and rapper. He is the recipient of four Grammy Awards. Damian Marley is the youngest son of reggae musician Bob Marley (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Julian Cope
artists.notes: Julian David Cope is an English musician and author. He was the singer and songwriter in Liverpool post-punk band the Teardrop Explodes and has followed a solo career since 1983 in addition to working on musical side projects such as Queen Elizabeth, Brain Donor and Black Sheep (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Lil B
artists.notes: Brandon Christopher McCartney, professionally known as Lil B and as his alter ego The BasedGod, is an American rapper. Lil B has recorded both solo and with Bay Area group The Pack (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Madonna
artists.notes: Madonna Louise Ciccone is an American singer-songwriter and actress. Widely dubbed the "Queen of Pop", Madonna has been noted for her continual reinvention and versatility in music production, songwriting, and visual presentation (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Midnight Oil
artists.notes: Midnight Oil (known informally as "The Oils") are an Australian rock band composed of Peter Garrett (vocals, harmonica), Rob Hirst (drums), Jim Moginie (guitar, keyboard) and Martin Rotsey (guitar). The group was formed in Sydney in 1972 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Danger Mouse & Black Thought
artists.notes: Brian Joseph Burton, known professionally as Danger Mouse, is an American musician, songwriter, and record producer. He came to prominence in 2004 when he released The Grey Album, which combined vocal performances from Jay-Z's The Black Album with instrumentals from the Beatles' The Beatles, also known as The White Album (Wikipedia). Tariq Luqmaan Trotter, better known as Black Thought, is an American rapper, actor and the lead MC of the Philadelphia-based hip hop group the Roots, which he co-founded with drummer Questlove (Ahmir Thompson). Regarded as "one of the most skilled, incisive, and prolific rappers of his time", he is widely lauded for his live performance skills, continuous multisyllabic rhyme schemes, complex lyricism, double entendres, and politically aware lyrics (Wikipedia). Danger Mouse and Black Thought collaborated on an album called Cheat Codes in 2022 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Angélique Kidjo
artists.notes: Angélique Kidjo is a Beninese-American singer-songwriter, actress, and activist noted for her diverse musical influences and creative music videos (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Ces Cru
artists.notes: Ces Cru is an American rap duo from Kansas City, Missouri, signed to independent record label Strange Music. The duo consists of members Donnie "Godemis" King and Mike "Ubiquitous" Viglione, but has had numerous members throughout the years (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Brandon Flowers
artists.notes: Brandon Flowers is an American musician, singer, songwriter, and philanthropist, best known as the lead singer, keyboardist, and occasional bassist of the Las Vegas-based rock band the Killers. In addition to his work with the Killers, Flowers has released two solo albums (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Chris Thile
artists.notes: Christopher Scott Thile is an American mandolinist, singer, songwriter, composer, and radio personality, best known for his work in the progressive acoustic trio Nickel Creek and the acoustic folk and progressive bluegrass quintet Punch Brothers (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Fit for an Autopsy
artists.notes: Fit for an Autopsy is an American deathcore band from Jersey City, New Jersey, formed in 2008. The band consists of guitarists Pat Sheridan, Will Putney and Tim Howley, drummer Josean Orta, vocalist Joe Badolato, and bassist Peter "Blue" Spinazola (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Mitski
artists.notes: Mitski Miyawaki, known professionally by the mononym Mitski, is a Japanese-born American singer-songwriter (Wikipedia).

artists.name: The Offspring
artists.notes: The Offspring is an American rock band from Garden Grove, California, formed in 1984 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Nahko and Medicine for the People
artists.notes: Nahko and Medicine for the People is an American world music group. The six-member band is headed by frontman Nahko Bear (Wikipedia).
artists.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Nahko and Medicine for the People

artists.name: Machine Head
artists.notes: Machine Head is an American heavy metal band from Oakland, California. The band was formed in 1991 by vocalist/rhythm guitarist Robb Flynn, who remains the only original member of the band. Machine Head's aggressive musicianship made it one of the pioneering bands in the new wave of American heavy metal (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Vansire
artists.notes: Vansire is a dream pop band from Rochester, Minnesota consisting of Josh Augustin and Sam Winemiller. They are currently signed to Spirit Goth Records. Vansire has performed at ROCKChester and First Avenue, played a live session with Audiotree, and collaborated with artists such as Chester Watson, Jeremiah Jae, and Mick Jenkins (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Wojtek
artists.notes: WOJTEK is a Polish-but-Berlin-based pianist and self-taught virtuoso deeply engaged in the climate movement (YouTube).

artists.name: Patrick Stump
artists.notes: Patrick Martin Stumph (born April 27, 1984), known professionally as Patrick Vaughn Stump, is an American musician, singer, and songwriter. He is the lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist of the rock band Fall Out Boy, originally from Wilmette, Illinois. His solo work has been described as "funky and R&B infused", while Billboard noted him as "one of the best voices in pop punk" (Wikipedia).

artists.name: The Casualties
artists.notes: The Casualties are an American hardcore punk band from New York City. Founding vocalist Jorge Herrera has been the most consistent member of the group's lineup, performing from 1990 - 2022, and other longtime members include guitarist Jake Kolatis, bassist Rick Lopez, and drummer Marc "Meggers" Eggers (Wikipedia).

artists.name: John Grant
artists.notes: John William Grant (born July 25, 1968) is an American singer, musician, and songwriter who holds both American and Icelandic citizenship. He first became known as the co-founder, lead singer, pianist, and primary songwriter for the alternative rock band the Czars. After releasing six albums from 1994 to 2006, the band split up and Grant retired for four years before starting a solo career (Wikipedia).

artists.name: GAWVI
artists.notes: Gabriel Alberto Azucena (born September 23, 1988), who goes by the stage name GAWVI (formerly G-Styles), is an American Christian hip hop artist and music producer, formerly for Reach Records. Born in the Bronx, New York, he has released three extended plays, five albums, and twenty-three singles including his songs "In the Water" and "Late Nights" (Wikipedia).

artists.name: StarKid Productions
artists.notes: StarKid Productions, also known as Team StarKid, is an American musical theatre company founded in 2009 at the University of Michigan by Darren Criss, Brian Holden, Matt Lang, and Nick Lang. Originally known for the viral success of their first musical, A Very Potter Musical, a parody of the Harry Potter series, the troupe primarily produces musical comedies inspired by pop culture, with original scripts, songs, and music. StarKid distributes their musicals for free on YouTube, with recent projects being funded by Kickstarter and physical ticket sales (Wikipedia).

artists.name: People Under the Stairs
artists.notes: People Under the Stairs was an American hip hop duo from Los Angeles, California, formed in 1997 and disbanded in 2019. Since their inception, the group consisted solely of Christopher Portugal (Thes One) and Michael Turner (Double K). The group employed a DIY work ethic of sampling, MCing, DJing, and producing all of their output (Wikipedia).

artists.name: The Acacia Strain
artists.notes: The Acacia Strain is an American deathcore band originally from Chicopee, Massachusetts. They are currently signed to Rise Records (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Snoop Dogg (prev. Snoop Lion)
artists.notes: Calvin Cordozar Broadus Jr. (born October 20, 1971), known professionally as Snoop Dogg (previously Snoop Doggy Dogg and briefly Snoop Lion), is an American rapper and actor. Broadus has sold over 23 million albums in the United States and 35 million albums worldwide. His accolades include an American Music Award, a Primetime Emmy Award, and 17 nominations at the Grammy Awards.

artists.name: Nas
artists.notes: Nasir bin Olu Dara Jones, better known by his stage name Nas, is an American rapper. Rooted in East Coast hip hop, he is regarded as one of the greatest rappers of all time. Nas is the son of jazz musician Olu Dara. Nas's debut album, Illmatic (1994), received universal acclaim upon release, and is considered to be one of the greatest hip hop albums of all time; in 2020, the album was inducted into the Library of Congress's National Recording Registry (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Common
artists.notes: Lonnie Rashid Lynn, known by his stage name Common (formerly known as Common Sense), is an American rapper and actor. He maintained an underground following into the late 1990s. He achieved mainstream success through his work with the Soulquarians (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Juice WRLD
artists.notes: Jarad Anthony Higgins (December 2, 1998 – December 8, 2019), known professionally as Juice Wrld, was an American rapper and singer-songwriter. He was a leading figure in the emo rap and SoundCloud rap genres which garnered mainstream attention during the mid-late 2010s (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Tyler, the Creator
artists.notes: Tyler Gregory Okonma, known professionally as Tyler, the Creator, is an American rapper and record producer. He is one of the founding members of the music collective Odd Future. Okonma has won two Grammy Awards, three BET Hip Hop Awards, a BRIT Award, and a MTV Video Music Award (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Flobots
artists.notes: Flobots is an experimental rap rock band from Denver, Colorado, formed in 2005 by Jamie Laurie. Flobots found mainstream success with their major label debut Fight with Tools (2007), featuring the single "Handlebars", which became a popular hit on Modern Rock radio in April 2008 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Cradle of Filth
artists.notes: Cradle of Filth are an English extreme metal band formed in Suffolk in 1991. The band's musical style evolved originally from black metal to a cleaner and more "produced" amalgam of gothic metal, symphonic metal and other metal genres. Their lyrical themes and imagery are heavily influenced by Gothic literature, poetry, mythology and horror films (Wikipedia).

artists.name: B.o.B
artists.notes: Bobby Ray Simmons Jr., known professionally as B.o.B, is an American rapper, record producer and conspiracy theorist. He was raised in Decatur, Georgia. B.o.B had several Billboard top 10 hits between 2009 and 2012 and has collaborated with musicians such as Bruno Mars, Taylor Swift, Hayley Williams, Jessie J, Janelle Monáe, and Nicki Minaj. B.o.B is a conspiracy theorist who has publicly endorsed the flat earth theory, famously getting into a social media and musical debate on the topic with astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson in 2016 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Sonny Rollins
artists.notes: Walter Theodore "Sonny" Rollins is an American jazz tenor saxophonist who is widely recognized as one of the most important and influential jazz musicians. In a seven-decade career, he has recorded over sixty albums as a leader. A number of his compositions, including "St. Thomas", "Oleo", "Doxy", "Pent-Up House", and "Airegin", have become jazz standards (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Enrique Iglesias
artists.notes: Enrique Miguel Iglesias Preysler is a Spanish singer and songwriter. Iglesias is one of the best-selling Latin music artists with estimated sales of over 70 million records worldwide. He has had five Billboard Hot 100 top five singles, including two number-ones. In December 2016, Billboard magazine named him the 14th most successful and top male dance club artist of all time (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Lake Street Dive
artists.notes: Lake Street Dive is a multi-genre band that was formed in 2004 at the New England Conservatory of Music in Boston. The band is based in Brooklyn and frequently tours in North America, Australia, and Europe (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Big Audio Dynamite II
artists.notes: Big Audio Dynamite (later known as Big Audio Dynamite II and Big Audio, and often abbreviated BAD) were an English band, formed in London in 1984 by Mick Jones, former lead guitarist and co-lead vocalist of the Clash. The band mixed various musical styles, incorporating elements of punk rock, dance music, hip hop, reggae, and funk. After releasing a number of well-received studio albums and touring extensively throughout the 1980s and 1990s, Big Audio Dynamite broke up in 1997. In 2011, the band embarked on a reunion tour (Wikipedia).

artists.name: 50 Cent
artists.notes: Curtis James Jackson III, known professionally as 50 Cent, is an American rapper, actor, television producer, and businessman. He was born in the South Jamaica neighborhood of Queens, New York City. 50 Cent has sold over 30 million albums worldwide and won several awards, including a Grammy Award, a Primetime Emmy Award, thirteen Billboard Music Awards, six World Music Awards, three American Music Awards and four BET Awards (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Ziggy Marley
artists.notes: David Nesta "Ziggy" Marley is a Jamaican singer, songwriter, musician, actor and philanthropist. He is the son of reggae icon Bob Marley and Rita Marley. He led the family band Ziggy Marley and the Melody Makers until 2002, with whom he released eight studio albums. After the disbandment, Ziggy launched a successful solo career by having released eight solo studio albums on his own record company, Tuff Gong Worldwide. Ziggy continues his father’s heritage to record and self-release all of his music. Marley is an eight-time Grammy Award winner and a Daytime Emmy Award recipient (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Sammy Hagar & The Circle
artists.notes: Sammy Hagar and the Circle (also known as The Circle) is an English-American rock supergroup band originally formed in Miami in 2014, consisting of former Montrose and Van Halen vocalist Sammy Hagar, original Van Halen bassist Michael Anthony, drummer Jason Bonham and guitarist Vic Johnson.

artists.name: Randy Newman
artists.notes: Randall Stuart Newman is an American singer-songwriter, arranger, composer, and pianist known for his non-rhotic Southern-accented singing style, early Americana-influenced songs (often with mordant or satirical lyrics), and various film scores. He is known for solo hits as well as the scores for various films including numerous Disney-Pixar movies (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Wildheart
artists.notes: Wildheart is a melodic hardcore band from Brisbane, Australia (YouTube). According to their bio added to the Environmental Music Prize website: "Wildheart have stormed onto the Australian hardcore scene, solidifying themselves as a heavy, emotional outfit. Demanding the attention of punters through their relentless live performances, Wildheart passionately advocates for open conversation and action surrounding mental health, social injustice, and discrimination through their lyrics that tackle topics such as Indigenous land rights, deaths in custody, and political neutrality in times of crisis. Our lead vocalist is Proud Yugambeh man Axel Best. Through his lyrics and stage show in Wildheart, Axel promotes Truth telling and a raised awareness for First Nations issues that he believes often do not receive coverage and support in mainstream media/music spaces that they deserve, including: Indigenous deaths in custody, climate change and the refusal of our government to adopt Indigenous backburning techniques, and First Nations Land and Water rights" (Environmental Music Project).

artists.name: Kreator
artists.notes: Kreator is a German thrash metal band from Essen, formed in 1982. The band's lineup has changed multiple times over its multi-decade career, most noticeably with their bassists and lead guitarists. They gained a large underground fanbase in the international thrash metal community, with their second studio album Pleasure to Kill (1986) regarded as an influential album of the genre (Wikipedia).

artists.name: GWAR
artists.notes: Gwar, often stylized as GWAR, is an American heavy metal band formed in Richmond, Virginia in 1984. Identified by their distinctively grotesque costumes, Gwar's core thematic and visual concept revolves around an elaborate science fiction-themed mythology which portrays the band members as barbaric interplanetary warriors, a narrative which serves as the basis for all of the band's albums, live shows and media. With over-the-top violent, sexual, and scatological humor typically incorporating social and political satire, Gwar has attracted both acclaim and controversy for its music and stage shows (Wikipedia).

artists.name: DJ Shadow
artists.notes: Joshua Paul Davis, better known by his stage name DJ Shadow, is an American DJ, songwriter and record producer. His debut studio album, Endtroducing....., was released in 1996. DJ Shadow's work involves manipulating samples, taking rare and seldom-heard pieces of music and reworking them into parts and phrases for his songs. Many of his tracks feature dozens of samples from a wide array of styles and influences, including rock, soul, funk, experimental, electronic and jazz (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Mo'Ju
artists.notes: Mojo Ruiz de Luzuriaga, known professionally as Mo'Ju and previously as Mojo Juju, is an ARIA Award-nominated Australian musician, best known for their 2018 album Native Tongue and the lead single of the same title. The single won the Best Independent Single category in the 2019 AIR Awards. They play guitar and piano, write songs and sing, and have created music in a number of genres.

artists.name: Sunfruits
artists.notes: Sunfruits is an Australian psychedelic indie-pop band comprised of Winter McQuinn, Evie Vlah, Elena Jones and Gene Argiro (Bandcamp).

artists.name: Georgia Mae
artists.notes: Georgia Mae is an Australian singer/songwriter who studied at the Queensland Conservatorium of Music and was nominated for the state’s ‘Most Promising Female Songwriter’ and ‘Best Female Pop Artist’ at the Queensland Music Awards in 2016. She was a writer and recording artist on television shows including Keeping Up With The Kardashians, and she worked in sound design at Skywalker Sound and Warner Bros. Studios (YouTube, Environmental Music Prize).
artists.link_2_title: Environmental Music Prize - Gentle - Georgia Mae

artists.name: Hazel Mei
artists.notes: Hazel Mei is an indie singer/songwriter based in Brisbane, Australia. According to her Bandcamp releases, she began releasing music in 2018 (Bandcamp).

artists.name: SheisArjuna
artists.notes: Shan Curry, also known as SheisArjuna, is an Australian singer/songwriter from regional Victoria. According to her Bandcamp, the SheisArjuna musical project began in 2020.

artists.name: Meraki Mae
artists.notes: Meraki Mae is an Australian singer/songwriter from Lismore, New South Wales. Mae is an activist on environmental and indigenous issues, and these themes can be heard in their music. Mae is queer, transgender, and nonbinary, and is outspoken about these identities (merakimaemusic.com).

artists.name: Anya Anastasia
artists.notes: Anya Anastasia is a singer/songwriter based in Adelaide, South Australia. Her musical style blends elements of folk and rock music, and her lyrics "ask questions about our society, conspiring to stir dissent and environmental action" (Bandcamp).

artists.name: Black Thought
artists.notes: Tariq Luqmaan Trotter, better known as Black Thought, is an American rapper, actor and the lead MC of the Philadelphia-based hip hop group the Roots, which he co-founded with drummer Questlove (Ahmir Thompson). Regarded as "one of the most skilled, incisive, and prolific rappers of his time", he is widely lauded for his live performance skills, continuous multisyllabic rhyme schemes, complex lyricism, double entendres, and politically aware lyrics (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Shawn Mendes
artists.notes: Shawn Mendes is a Canadian pop singer-songwriter. His album "Handwritten" debuted atop the US Billboard 200, making Mendes one of five artists ever to debut at number one before the age of 18 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Sasha Alex Sloan
artists.notes: Alexandra Artourovna Yatchenko, known professionally as Sasha Alex Sloan (previously Sasha Sloan), is an American singer-songwriter. Her debut album, Only Child, was released on October 16, 2020. Sloan's second studio album I Blame the World was released on May 13, 2022 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Bomb the Music Industry!
artists.notes: Bomb the Music Industry! (commonly abbreviated as Bomb or BtMI!) was an American punk rock musical collective from Baldwin, Nassau County, New York, United States, led by singer-songwriter, producer, and multi-instrumentalist Jeff Rosenstock. The band was known for their DIY punk ethic and commitment to accessibility. In addition to distributing their music via a pay what you want model, they primarily played affordable all-ages shows and established an accessible and collaborative environment for fans (Wikipedia).
artists.link_2_title: Quote Unquote Records - Bomb The Music Industry!

artists.name: Shovels & Rope
artists.notes: Shovels & Rope are an American folk duo from Charleston, South Carolina composed of husband and wife Michael Trent and Cary Ann Hearst. Combining threads from their individual solo careers, Shovels & Rope blends traditional folk, rock and roll and country rock (Wikipedia).

artists.name: The Weather Station
artists.notes: The Weather Station is a Canadian folk music band fronted by Tamara Lindeman, formed in 2006. The band membership has changed over the years, and as of 2022 includes Lindeman (lead vocals, piano), Ben Whiteley (bass), Johnny Spence (keyboards), Will Kidman (guitar), Christine Bougie (guitar), Karen Ng (saxophone, clarinet), Evan Cartwright (drums), and Kieran Adams (drums) (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Will Smith
artists.notes: Willard Carroll Smith II, briefly known as the Fresh Prince, is an American actor and rapper. He has received multiple accolades, including an Academy Award, a BAFTA Award, and four Grammy Awards. He first gained recognition as part of a hip hop duo with DJ Jazzy Jeff, with whom he released five studio albums. He also released four solo albums. He has received four Grammy Awards for his rap performances (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Original London Cast of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
artists.notes: Various artists contributed to the 2013 London production of the musical "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory," based on the children's novel by Roald Dahl. The show was based on a book by David Greig and included music by Marc Shaiman and lyrics by Shaiman and Scott Wittman (Wikipedia). The original London Cast Recording featured performances by Douglas Hodge (Willy Wonka), Nigel Planer (Grandpa Joe), Clive Carter (Mr. Salt), and Paul J. Medford (Mr. Beauregarde) (Wikipedia).
artists.link_1_title: Wikipedia - Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (musical)

artists.name: Shunaji
artists.notes: Shunaji is a Nigerian born hip-hop producer, rapper and vocalist from Rome, Italy and currently based in London, UK (Montreaux Jazz Festival, shunaji.com). She is the recipient of the Do It Differently/MOBO Help Musicians Fund awards and participated in Sound and Music's Interpreting Isolation grants (shunaji.com).

artists.name: Durand Jones & The Indications
artists.notes: Durand Jones & The Indications is an American contemporary R&B and soul group founded by the core songwriting trio of singer Durand Jones, singer/drummer Aaron Frazer, and guitarist Blake Rhein. Formed in 2012, the band came to prominence as part of the soul revivalist movement around the time of the reissue of their debut album in 2018 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Sirintip
artists.notes: Sirintip "Tippan" Phasuk, known simply as Sirintip, is a Bangkok-born Swedish-Thai artist. Sirintip is an experimental trilingual singer and composer in both the jazz and pop worlds. Her unique use of effect pedals with her voice has brought her around the world performing with Snarky Puppy, Benny Andersson (ABBA), as a finalist in the Thelonious Monk International Competition, and opening for Wayne Shorter at the Polar Music Prize (Bandcamp, Wikipedia). Sirintip is dedicated to sustainability in all aspects of making music and recommends the following ideas for artists looking to be more sustainable: solar powered performances, recording at a solar powered studio, printing bioplastic vinyl, a green rider for touring to promote sustainable actions from promoters and venues, sustainable touring routes and travel methods, recycled cardboard CD cases, and sustainable merch (personal correspondence with artist).

artists.name: The Living End
artists.notes: The Living End is an Australian punk rockabilly band from Melbourne, formed in 1994. Since 2002, the line-up consists of Chris Cheney (vocals, guitar), Scott Owen (double bass, vocals), and Andy Strachan (drums). The Band was nominated 27 times and won five awards at the Australian ARIA Music Awards ceremonies (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Flogging Molly
artists.notes: Flogging Molly is an American seven-piece Celtic punk band formed in Los Angeles in 1995, led by Irish vocalist Dave King, formerly of the hard rock band Fastway. They are signed to their own record label, Borstal Beat Records (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Anvil
artists.notes: Anvil is a Canadian heavy metal band formed in Toronto, Ontario, in 1978. The band currently consists of founding members Steve "Lips" Kudlow (vocals, guitar), Robb Reiner (drums, percussion), and Chris Robertson (bass). As of 2022, the band has released nineteen studio albums, and have been cited as having influenced many notable heavy metal groups, including Megadeth, Slayer, Anthrax, and Metallica (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Queensrÿche
artists.notes: Queensrÿche is an American heavy metal band. It formed in 1982 in Bellevue, Washington, out of the local band the Mob. The band has released 16 studio albums, one EP, and several DVDs, and continues to tour and record. The original lineup consisted of guitarists Michael Wilton and Chris DeGarmo, drummer Scott Rockenfield, bassist Eddie Jackson, and lead vocalist Geoff Tate (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Nothing But Thieves
artists.notes: Nothing but Thieves are an English rock band, formed in 2012 in Southend-on-Sea, Essex. They consist of lead vocalist and guitarist Conor Mason, guitarist Joe Langridge-Brown, guitarist and keyboardist Dominic Craik, bassist Philip Blake, and drummer James Price (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Ministry
artists.notes: Ministry is an American industrial metal band founded in Chicago, Illinois in 1981 by producer, singer, and instrumentalist Al Jourgensen. Originally a synth-pop outfit, Ministry evolved into one of the pioneers of industrial rock and industrial metal in the late 1980s. The band's lineup has changed frequently, leaving Jourgensen as the sole original member (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Ani DiFranco
artists.notes: Angela Maria "Ani" DiFranco is an American-Canadian singer-songwriter. She has released more than 20 albums. DiFranco's music has been classified as folk rock and alternative rock, although it has additional influences from punk, funk, hip hop and jazz. She has released all her albums on her own record label, Righteous Babe (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Passenger
artists.notes: Michael David Rosenberg, better known by his stage name Passenger, is an English indie folk singer-songwriter. From 2003 to 2009, Rosenberg fronted a band by the same name; he opted to keep the Passenger moniker for his solo work after the band dissolved. Rosenberg is best known for the 2012 song "Let Her Go", which topped the charts in 16 countries and accumulated more than 3.3 billion views on YouTube (Wikipedia).

artists.name: P!nk
artists.notes: Alecia Beth Moore Hart, known professionally as Pink (stylized as P!nk), is an American singer, songwriter and actress. Pink has been described as "pop royalty" for her distinctive raspy voice and acrobatic stage presence. She has sold over 135 million records worldwide (60 million albums and 75 million singles), making her one of the world's best-selling music artists (Wikipedia).

artists.name: JID
artists.notes: Destin Choice Route, better known by his stage name JID (also stylized J.I.D), is an American rapper and singer. He is a part of the musical collective Spillage Village, founded by EarthGang in 2010, with Hollywood JB, JordxnBryant, and 6lack, among others. He is signed to J. Cole's Dreamville Records and Interscope Records. He is also a member of the hip hop supergroup Zoink Gang, with Smino, Buddy, and Guapdad 4000 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Kendrick Lamar
artists.notes: Kendrick Lamar Duckworth is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. Known as "King Kendrick", he is widely regarded as one of the most influential rappers of his generation. His works, which regularly infuse social, political, religious, and philosophical influences, became a catalyst in the rise of social consciousness amongst Millennials. Lamar has been named the second-greatest rapper of all time by Billboard and Vibe, and has garnered critical acclaim for his signature cadences, artistic reinventions, and introspective songwriting (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Dolly Parton
artists.notes: Dolly Rebecca Parton is an American singer-songwriter, musician, actress, philanthropist, and businesswoman, known primarily for her decades-long career in country music. With a career spanning over fifty years, Parton has been described as a "country music legend" and has sold more than 100 million records worldwide, making her one of the best-selling female artists of all time (Wikipedia).

artists.name: The RTs
artists.notes: The RTs are a five-piece rock band based in New York City (bandcamp). The band's lineup consists of Mike Harlen (bass), Alden Harris-McCoy (guitar), Patrick Sargent (saxophone and keys), Michael Fatum (trumpet) and Jamie Donald Eblen (drums). Notably, all five convservatory-trained band members sing during performances (thertsband.com).

artists.name: Jay Electronica
artists.notes: Elpadaro F. Electronica Allah (born Timothy Elpadaro Thedford), known professionally as Jay Electronica (stylized as J A Y E L E C T R O N I C A), is an American rapper and record producer. Born and raised in New Orleans, he first received widespread attention in 2007, after the release of his mixtape, Act I: Eternal Sunshine (The Pledge). Its success along with the stand-alone single "Exhibit C" subsequently led New York rapper Jay-Z to sign Electronica to his record label, Roc Nation in 2010 (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Jason Derulo
artists.notes: Jason Joel Desrouleaux, known professionally as Jason Derulo, is an American pop and R&B singer and songwriter. Since the start of his solo recording career in 2009, he has sold over 250 million singles worldwide and has achieved eleven platinum singles (Wikipedia).

artists.name: Jimmy Buffet
